article: 13 Simple Ways to Make $1000 a Week with Uber Eats
intro: Delivering for Uber Eats is a great way to earn extra cash, but is it possible to make $1000 per week? It might be a learning curve at first, but it’s totally achievable and many drivers have done it. In this article, we’ll teach you the best tips and strategies to boost your weekly earnings on Uber Eats. We’ll also explain if it’s helpful to double-up on apps like Doordash, plus discuss which delivery service pays more.

points.name: Easy Ways to Make $1000 a Week on Uber Eats

steps.title: Set daily goals to stay motivated and keep you on track.
steps.subtitle: Divide $1000 by the number of days you plan to deliver in a week, then divide that number by the number of hours you want to work per day. From there, you can figure out how much you need to make per hour to reach your weekly earnings goal. Setting a goal is one of the best ways to stay focused, and it can help you develop discipline and a stronger work ethic.
sub-points: If you want to work 5 days a week and 6 hours a day, for instance, you would need to earn $33.33 per hour. This sounds a lot more doable than making $1000 a week, and it can give you a better idea of how long you need to work each day to reach your goal.

points.name: Does Uber Eats or DoorDash pay more for drivers?

steps.title: Currently, DoorDash pays drivers more based on volume and availability.
steps.subtitle: However, pay is highly dependent on your delivery time and location. Both apps have similar pay models, rates, tips, and incentives, but DoorDash has a greater share of the food delivery market than Uber Eats. Since more people use DoorDash compared to Uber Eats, you can potentially complete more orders and earn more per hour as a Dasher.
sub-points: In general, Uber Eats earnings per trip are 18% higher than DoorDash, but DoorDash drivers complete 1.5 trips for every trip completed on Uber Eats.

points.name: Is DoorDash or Uber Eats better to work for?

steps.title: Overall, there are more perks working for DoorDash than Uber Eats.
steps.subtitle: DoorDash drivers typically earn more, can schedule their hours in advance, and have more time to decide to accept an order. Before deciding whether to work for DoorDash or Uber Eats, learn which service is more popular in your area. Deliver with DoorDash for one week and Uber Eats the following week, then compare your earnings to see which one is more profitable.
sub-points: At the end of the day, both DoorDash and Uber Eats are excellent ways to earn extra money, and you can always work for multiple apps to reach your financial goals!

points.name: How much can you make with Uber Eats?

steps.title: Pay depends on where you deliver, how long you work, and your tips.
steps.subtitle: Uber Eats pay depends on your location, market, and working hours, but according to Indeed, drivers earn $24.22 per hour on average in the United States, before taxes and expenses. If you work 8 hours a day and 7 days a week, that would be around $194 per day (or $1356 per week).
sub-points: It would be challenging to earn $2000 per week with Uber Eats, but that doesn’t mean it’s impossible! If you take advantage of surge pricing and promotions, are strategic with your schedule and orders, and provide great customer service, you can turn it into a full-time job.
If you deliver food in high market areas, it can definitely help you complete more orders (and earn more money). Check out the  with the highest demand for Uber Eats Drivers.

points.name: Pros & Cons of Working For Uber Eats

steps.title: Some cons of working for Uber Eats include long hours and car damage.
steps.subtitle: Although working for Uber Eats is super convenient and flexible, there are a few downsides when it comes to paying for certain expenses and using your car frequently:
sub-points: An Uber Eats driver is classified as an independent contractor, which means Uber won’t reimburse your expenses for gas, tolls, parking, and car maintenance.
Uber Eats pay depends on your location and delivery schedule, which means you might earn significantly less (or more) on certain days.
Driving every week may wear down your vehicle and accelerate depreciation.
You might have to work anywhere from 40 to 65+ hours a week to make $1000, depending on your area and schedule.
